Maintaining a healthy weight can reduce the risk of chronic diseases associated with being overweight and obese.
Visit a nutritionist for information on the importance of healthy eating and physical activity to maintain a healthy weight.

People who are overweight or obese are at increased risk for chronic conditions, such as high blood pressure, diabetes, and high cholesterol.
Anyone who is overweight should try to avoid gaining more weight. Also, if you are overweight along with other risk factors (such as high levels of LDL cholesterol , low HDL cholesterol or high blood pressure), you should try to lose weight. Even a small decrease (as little as 10% of your current weight) can help decrease the risk of disease. Talk with your healthcare provider to establish proper ways to lose weight.
